abstract: Thomas L Friedman Op-Ed column notes two theories behind the spontaneous social protests erupting from the Arab world to Wall Street; cites Paul Gilding's book The Great Disruption, in which he argues that these demonstrations are a sign that the current growth-obsessed capitalist system is reaching its limits; holds that, by contrast, John Hagel III and John Seely Brown's book The Power of Pull suggests a Big Shift precipitated by the merging of globalization and the Information Technology Revolution.
snippet: What’s behind all the social protests erupting from Tunisia to Wall Street? Some call it The Great Disruption. Others call it The Big Shift. You decide.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: What’s behind all the social protests erupting from Tunisia to Wall Street? Some call it The Great Disruption. Others call it The Big Shift. You decide.
